sections.title: Syntax
sections.raw_content:
A returnStatement is:

  return

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: A return statement terminates the procedure (or main program) in which it appears. Ordinarily, a procedure (or main program) terminates by reaching its end; the return statement is used to cause early termination.
sections.mdown_content: A **return** statement terminates the **procedure** (or main program) in which it appears. Ordinarily, a procedure (or main program) terminates by reaching its end; the **return** statement is used to cause early termination.

sections.title: Example
code:
procedure double
            if errorHasOccurred then
                return  % Terminate this procedure
            end if
             handle usual case in this procedure 
        end double
sections.raw_content: This procedure takes no action if the errorHasOccurred flag has been set to true.
sections.mdown_content: This procedure takes no action if the *errorHasOccurred *flag has been set to true.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: A return must not appear as a statement in (the outermost level of) a module, nor can it appear in a function.
sections.mdown_content: A **return** must not appear as a statement in (the outermost level of) a module, nor can it appear in a **function**.
